<cs> my lords it is with very great diffidence that i speak in this debate particularly as so many of the points which one wished to raise have already been covered with far <e>

<cs> with that possible exception i am not qualified to speak there all the countries that used to be administered by us have either opted for military rule or for presidential rule <e> <s> where political parties are allowed only one is permitted and opposition as we understand it does not exist it comes from within the framework of that political party <e> <s> the truth is that the african people do not like the role of opposition <e> <s> noble lords opposite may say they are not the only ones <e> <s> but in africa it is carried further <e> <s> there are no pickings <e> <s> i do not wish to be unkind but the role of opposition simply does not appeal to them and this was all too clearly shown by the recent elections <e> <s> the reverend sithole contested those elections <e> <s> he did not do at all well he won only seats <e>

<cs> my lords i very much hesitate to intervene in the second reading of this bill because i am aware that it has the support of the derbyshire county council and indeed in particular district councils as well <e> <s> however there are two clauses which i look upon with very considerable doubt <e> <s> i would not dream of intervening unless citizens of the town of buxton which is closely concerned with clauses and had not been to see me and say that they were seriously concerned <e> <s> i must also at this early stage declare an interest in that my family has had a long connection with buxton and we still have interests smaller alas <e> <s> than they were in the town <e> <s> i hope that your lordships will not think that i am in any way speaking from my pocket <e> <s> i speak because i also have some interest in that many years ago i was mayor of buxton for two years <e>

<cs> my lords i hesitate to get to my feet yet again because i am sure the house has heard enough from me <e> <s> i do so only because i am anxious to do what is correct <e> <s> until i came down to the house this evening i had no idea that the second reading of this bill was coming before the house tonight but as i am in the chamber and as the bill is receiving its second reading i wish to make it quite clear that i have a very substantial interest in this bill <e> <s> as i am present i feel it is only right to declare it <e>
<cs> my lords i was once invited <e>

<cs> my lords i should like to interrupt the noble lord <e> <s> he has made a very strong statement talking about dishonest practices <e> <s> i am a member of the tote board and i challenge him to repeat what he has said in the unprivileged parts outside this house <e>
<cs> my lords i had not intended to intervene <e>

<cs> if i may intervene it is quite untrue to say that the jockey club acquired extra paddocks merely to breed pheasants <e> <s> it is quite untrue to say that the jockey club acquired those extra paddocks to rear pheasants <e> <s> it is true that there is a jockey club shoot <e> <s> it is very modest and the suggestion casts a slur on a very distinguished body of people <e>
<cs> i will take up the matter privately with the noble lord lord wigg <e> <s> he will hear from me in due course <e>

<cs> i rise with diffidence to support this amendment partly because i have great sympathy with what was said on behalf of the stable lads employers <e> <s> i must make it clear that i speak alone <e> <s> i have the privilege of being a member of the jockey club and i have the good fortune to be the owner of racehorses <e> <s> it is as an owner of racehorses that i support this amendment <e>
